Module it.polimi.sw.gianpaolocugola47
Package it.polimi.sw.gianpaolocugola47.view.gui

Class SecretObjController

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.sw.gianpaolocugola47.view.gui.SecretObjController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class SecretObjController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This class is the controller of the secret objective scene. It contains the methods to set the secret objective of the player and to send it to the server.

      public void initialize(URL location, ResourceBundle resources)
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable

    • start

      public void start(Client client, PlayerTable playerTable)
      This method is called when the controller is created. It sets the client and the player table that are using this controller. It also sets the starting card and draws the objectives of the player.
      Parameters:
      client - The client that is using this controller
      playerTable - The player table that is using this controller

    • handleSecret1Clicked

      private void handleSecret1Clicked(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
      This method is called when the first secret objective is clicked. It sets the selected objective to the first secret objective and sets the border of the image view.
      Parameters:
      event - The event that triggered the method

    • handleSecret2Clicked

      private void handleSecret2Clicked(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
      This method is called when the second secret objective is clicked. It sets the selected objective to the second secret objective and sets the border of the image view.
      Parameters:
      event - The event that triggered the method

    • handleObjButtonClicked

      private void handleObjButtonClicked(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This method is called when the send button is clicked. It sets the secret objective of the player and sends it to the server.
      Parameters:
      event - The event that triggered the method

    • setImageViewBorder

      private void setImageViewBorder(javafx.scene.image.ImageView selectedImageView)
      This method sets the border of the selected image view.
      Parameters:
      selectedImageView - The image view that has to be selected
